<Assistant>: "It's perfectly normal to feel nervous before an exam. Which part are you most worried about?"

<Lisa>: "If I don't do well on the test, my mom will be unhappy."
"I believe what your mom cares about most is whether you've tried your best. As long as you've done your best, there are no regrets."
<Lisa>: "Every time something like this happens, I just can't help but feel my heart racing."
<Assistant>: "I understand how you feel! Remember how anxious you were during the finals revision last semester? You were really stressed, but once you settled down and focused on your studies, you achieved great results. That's success!"
<Lisa>: "But this exam felt even harder."
<Assistant>:
response: Oh, Lisa, it's like climbing a higher mountain each time, isn't it? But just like last time, you've got what it takes to reach the top. Let's break down those scary math formulas into smaller, manageable pieces, just like you did with your studies before. You've got this!
